verses.verse: Ἔλεγεν <WG2036> Elegen [Jesus] also said ( The Parable of the Shrewd Manager) δὲ <WG1161> de vvv καὶ <WG2532> kai vvv πρὸς <WG4314> pros to τοὺς <WG3588> tous [His] μαθητάς <WG3101> mathētas disciples , Ἄνθρωπός <WG444> Anthrōpos man τις <WG5100> tis a ἦν <WG1510> ēn “ There was πλούσιος <WG4145> plousios rich ὃς <WG3739> hos whose εἶχεν <WG2192> eichen - οἰκονόμον <WG3623> oikonomon manager καὶ <WG2532> kai - οὗτος <WG3778> houtos . . . διεβλήθη <WG1225> dieblēthē was accused of αὐτῷ <WG846> autō . . . ὡς <WG5613> hōs . . . διασκορπίζων <WG1287> diaskorpizōn wasting τὰ <WG3588> ta - ὑπάρχοντα <WG5225> hyparchonta possessions . αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his

Δέξαι <WG1209> Dexai ‘ Take σου <WG4771> sou your τὰ <WG3588> ta - γράμματα <WG1121> grammata bill καὶ <WG2532> kai and γράψον <WG1125> grapson write ὀγδοήκοντα <WG3589> ogdoēkonta eighty , ’

( Or everyone is urged to enter into it) βιάζεται <WG971> biazetai is forcing his way

Πᾶς <WG3956> Pas Anyone ὁ <WG3588> ho who ἀπολύων <WG630> apolyōn divorces τὴν <WG3588> tēn - γυναῖκα <WG1135> gynaika wife αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his καὶ <WG2532> kai and γαμῶν <WG1060> gamōn marries ἑτέραν <WG2087> heteran another [woman] μοιχεύει <WG3431> moicheuei commits adultery , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὁ <WG3588> ho he who ἀπολελυμένην <WG630> apolelymenēn a divorced woman ἀπὸ <WG575> apo . . . ἀνδρὸς <WG435> andros . . . γαμῶν <WG1060> gamōn marries μοιχεύει <WG3431> moicheuei commits adultery .

Ἄνθρωπος <WG444> Anthrōpos man ( The Rich Man and Lazarus) δέ <WG1161> de Now τις <WG5100> tis a ἦν <WG1510> ēn there was πλούσιος <WG4145> plousios rich καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἐνεδιδύσκετο <WG1737> enedidysketo dressed in πορφύραν <WG4209> porphyran purple καὶ <WG2532> kai and βύσσον <WG1040> bysson fine linen , εὐφραινόμενος <WG2165> euphrainomenos who lived each day in joyous καθ’ <WG2596> kath’ . . . ἡμέραν <WG2250> hēmeran . . . λαμπρῶς <WG2988> lamprōs splendor .

πτωχὸς <WG4434> ptōchos beggar δέ <WG1161> de And τις <WG5100> tis a ὀνόματι <WG3686> onomati named Λάζαρος <WG2976> Lazaros Lazarus ἐβέβλητο <WG906> ebeblēto lay πρὸς <WG4314> pros at τὸν <WG3588> ton - πυλῶνα <WG4440> pylōna gate , αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his εἱλκωμένος <WG1669> heilkōmenos covered with sores

καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐπιθυμῶν <WG1937> epithymōn longing χορτασθῆναι <WG5526> chortasthēnai to be fed ἀπὸ <WG575> apo with τῶν <WG3588> tōn the πιπτόντων <WG4098> piptontōn crumbs that fell ἀπὸ <WG575> apo from τῆς <WG3588> tēs the τραπέζης <WG5132> trapezēs table . τοῦ <WG3588> tou vvv πλουσίου <WG4145> plousiou rich man’s ἀλλὰ <WG235> alla - καὶ <WG2532> kai Even οἱ <WG3588> hoi the κύνες <WG2965> kynes dogs ἐρχόμενοι <WG2064> erchomenoi came ἐπέλειχον <WG621> epeleichon [and] licked τὰ <WG3588> ta - ἕλκη <WG1668> helkē sores . αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his

Ἐγένετο <WG1096> Egeneto . . . δὲ <WG1161> de One day ἀποθανεῖν <WG599> apothanein died τὸν <WG3588> ton the πτωχὸν <WG4434> ptōchon beggar καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀπενεχθῆναι <WG667> apenechthēnai was carried αὐτὸν <WG846> auton - ὑπὸ <WG5259> hypo by τῶν <WG3588> tōn the ἀγγέλων <WG32> angelōn angels εἰς <WG1519> eis to τὸν <WG3588> ton - κόλπον <WG2859> kolpon side . ( Greek into Abraham’s bosom; similarly in verse 23) Ἀβραάμ <WG11> Abraam Abraham’s ἀπέθανεν <WG599> apethanen died δὲ <WG1161> de And καὶ <WG2532> kai also ὁ <WG3588> ho the πλούσιος <WG4145> plousios rich man καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐτάφη <WG2290> etaphē was buried .

καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἐν <WG1722> en In τῷ <WG3588> tō - ᾅδῃ <WG86> hadē Hades , ἐπάρας <WG1869> eparas he looked up τοὺς <WG3588> tous . . . ὀφθαλμοὺς <WG3788> ophthalmous . . . αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou . . . ὑπάρχων <WG5225> hyparchōn where he was ἐν <WG1722> en in βασάνοις <WG931> basanois torment , ὁρᾷ <WG3708> hora [and] saw Ἀβραὰμ <WG11> Abraam Abraham ἀπὸ <WG575> apo from μακρόθεν <WG3113> makrothen afar , καὶ <WG2532> kai with Λάζαρον <WG2976> Lazaron Lazarus ἐν <WG1722> en by τοῖς <WG3588> tois - κόλποις <WG2859> kolpois side . αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai So αὐτὸς <WG846> autos he φωνήσας <WG5455> phōnēsas cried out εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen . . . , Πάτερ <WG3962> Pater ‘ Father Ἀβραάμ <WG11> Abraam Abraham , ἐλέησόν <WG1653> eleēson have mercy on με <WG1473> me me καὶ <WG2532> kai and πέμψον <WG3992> pempson send Λάζαρον <WG2976> Lazaron Lazarus ἵνα <WG2443> hina to βάψῃ <WG911> bapsē dip τὸ <WG3588> to the ἄκρον <WG206> akron tip τοῦ <WG3588> tou of δακτύλου <WG1147> daktylou finger αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his ὕδατος <WG5204> hydatos in water καὶ <WG2532> kai and καταψύξῃ <WG2711> katapsyxē cool τὴν <WG3588> tēn - γλῶσσάν <WG1100> glōssan tongue . μου <WG1473> mou my ὅτι <WG3754> hoti For ὀδυνῶμαι <WG3600> odynōmai I am in agony ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē - φλογὶ <WG5395> phlogi fire . ’ ταύτῃ <WG3778> tautē this

Εἶπεν <WG2036> Eipen answered , δὲ <WG1161> de But Ἀβραάμ <WG11> Abraam Abraham Τέκνον <WG5043> Teknon ‘ Child , μνήσθητι <WG3403> mnēsthēti remember ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that ἀπέλαβες <WG618> apelabes you received τὰ <WG3588> ta [things] , ἀγαθά <WG18> agatha good σου <WG4771> sou your ἐν <WG1722> en during τῇ <WG3588> tē - ζωῇ <WG2222> zōē lifetime σου <WG4771> sou your καὶ <WG2532> kai [while] Λάζαρος <WG2976> Lazaros Lazarus ὁμοίως <WG3668> homoiōs [received] τὰ <WG3588> ta - κακά <WG2556> kaka bad [things] . νῦν <WG3568> nyn now δὲ <WG1161> de But ὧδε <WG5602> hōde here , παρακαλεῖται <WG3870> parakaleitai he is comforted σὺ <WG4771> sy you δὲ <WG1161> de while ὀδυνᾶσαι <WG3600> odynasai are in agony .
